content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-027-22-B
|Item_parent=Prevention of foetal risks: infection, drugs, toxic substances, irradiation
|Item_parent_short=Prevention of foetal risks: infection, drugs, toxic substances, irradiation
|Rank=B
|Title=Knowing the mechanisms of maternal-fetal transmission of streptococcus B
|Description=None
|Topic=Physiopathology
|Contributors=Alexandre Vivanti, Philippe Deruelle
|Order=22}}
The prevalence of vaginal carriage in France is between 10 and 20%.

Maternal-foetal infection with streptococcus B occurs via the vaginal, ascending route, with contamination during passage through the maternal genital tract during childbirth or prolonged rupture of foetal membranes.

properties.question: How does maternal-fetal infection with streptococcus B typically occur?
properties.option_b: By vertical transmission during childbirth or prolonged rupture of foetal membranes
properties.option_c: Through the placenta during the second trimester
properties.option_d: By ingestion of contaminated food during pregnancy
